figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 16. Annenkova mastigophora (Annenkova, 1952) n. comb. A. Lectotype (ZIRAS-27061), oblique, lateral view. B. Same, chaetigers 4–7, left neuropodia, asterisks on gonopodial lobes. C. Same, chaetiger 10, basal, medial and distal notochaetal regions. D. Same, chaetigers 7–11, neuropodia. E. Same, falciger with incurved crest tip (insert: complete neurohook). F. Same, falciger with perpendicular crest tip (insert: complete neurohook). G. Same, falciger with broken crest tip. Scale bars: A: 5 m, B: 0.2 mm, C: 40 µm, D: 1 mm, E: 50 µm, F: 57 µm, G: 50 µm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 17. Annenkova mastigophora (Annenkova, 1952) n. comb. A. Non-type specimen (CAS-26832), dorsal view. B. Same, ventral view. C. Same, head, palps and most antennae removed (BS: branchial scars, Ca: caruncle, LL: lateral lip, PS: palp scar). D. Same, chaetiger 2, neurohook (insert: multiarticulated handle region). E. Same, chaetiger 15, neurohooks (inserts: oligoarticulated regions and crests). F. Same, chaetiger 25, right parapodium, posterior view (notice the single articulation). Scale bars: A: 1.2 mm, B: 1.1 mm, C: 0.25 mm, D: 140 µm, E–F: 190 µm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 17 .
Annenkova mastigophora
( Annenkova, 1952 ) n. comb. A. Non-type specimen (CAS-26832), dorsal view. B. Same, ventral view. C. Same, head, palps and most antennae removed (BS: branchial scars, Ca: caruncle, LL: lateral lip, PS: palp scar). D. Same, chaetiger 2, neurohook (insert: multiarticulated handle region). E. Same, chaetiger 15, neurohooks (inserts: oligoarticulated regions and crests). F. Same, chaetiger 25, right parapodium, posterior view (notice the single articulation). Scale bars: A: 1.2 mm, B: 1.1 mm, C: 0.25 mm, D: 140 µm, E–F: 190 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional material .
Northeastern Pacific Ocean, Bering Sea.
One anterior fragment ( CAS-26832 ), Navarin Basin , Alaska , Stat. 11 ( 59°43.7' N , 175°01.2' W ), 122.6 m,
10 May 1980
. One median fragment (SIO- RAS-unnumb.), Bering Sea, R /
V Vitjaz
, Stat. 548 (median fragment, with most of its tunic on site, 55 mm long, 6 mm wide, 36 chaetigers). A large specimen without anterior end, and an anterior fragment (SIORAS-unnumb.), Bering Sea, R /
V Vitjaz
, Stat. 566 (larger fragm. 102 mm long, 11 mm wide, 80 chaetigers; pygidium exposed)
.

Description .
Lectotype (ZIRAS-27061) anterior fragment, pale; body oval in cross section, heavily contracted, segments very short ( Fig. 16A ); 42 mm long, 7.5 mm wide, cephalic cage (damaged) 7 mm , 45 chaetigers. Tunic densely papillated, mostly eroded, with little fine sediment cover on it, remaining in interparapodial areas (very thick in some non-type specimens in SIORAS).

Posterior end lost in types ; one non-type specimen ( SIORAS ) with posterior end tapering; pygidium with anus terminal, without anal cirri
.

Remarks. The combination
Flabelligera mastigophora
was introduced by Uschakov (1950:206) , but because it included a short diagnosis (whip-like crest of multiarticulated falcigers) must be regarded as a nomen nudum . The original type series is in poor shape; the best preserved specimen has been designated as the lectotype ; the paralectotypes provide enough morphological details as to be included in the same species, but they are poorly preserved.
Distribution. Restricted to Arctic or subarctic shallow waters, being recorded for the Okhotsk, Chukchi and Bering Seas, in shallow water soft bottoms.
